THIRST

Inspiration

Style

Health

Fun

Decor


During an intensive four day masterclass taken by Chris Murphy we began looking at developing concepts for 'micro-publications. This is where my concept for 'Thirst' was born. We explored how we are living in fast paced industry where content is always changing and taking form on different platforms.

We started off our masterclass in groups where we brainstormed and drew up a bunch of paper protypes and ideas. We then got to go and explore our idea and consider how it might be packaged, delivered and consumed. Our goal was to create a product that might (but neednâ€™t be) developed further.

I wanted to develop something that I was going to find genuinely useful. So I decided to develop a health app that encouraged staying hydrated. This is where the real fun began and I got to start bringing together my sketches and bringing the idea to life on screen.

I wanted the app to be effective, fast and visually pleasing. So I looked at other apps I found just that and put together a mood board of inspiration.

The idea is that the user can easily create a profile with their specific details. You can then moniter what you drink during the day using easy to understand icons. This will be then relfect into an easy to understand moniter that will go up and down depending on how much you drank that day.
